results.title: Vidocq et les Faux Temoins = Vidocq and the False Witnesses
results.brief_description:
Vidocq is attempting to locate, Grouard, part antique dealer, part fence, who got him convicted a few years earlier thanks to a false testimony.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Gabriel Gobin, Fernand Berset.

results.title: La Bijouterie Jacquelin = Jacquelin Jeweller
results.brief_description:
Vicdocq is back in Paris, with poor old Flambart forever on his trail. After a close encounter with the police, Vidocq seeks refuge in a jewellery shop which happens to belong to Jacquelin, an old army pal. Jacquelin immediately hires Vidocq to work in the shop where his past experiences as a convict proves useful to fend off swindlers of all kind. Vidocq also becomes quite taken by Jacquelin’s upstairs neighbour, Annette.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Leonce Corne, Jacques Bodoin.

results.title: L'eternel Evade = the Elusive Prisoner
results.brief_description:
Inspector Flambart is escorting a chain of convicts taking Vidocq back to the prison for the fourth time. Vidocq and his two accomplices manage to break away from the chain gang. Flambart immediadelity launches the chase to re-capture them, but Vidocq has found a safe haven with a most welcoming milkmaid.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Marcel Bluwal ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Jacques Seiler, Mario David.

results.title: Les Hommes et la Mer (Ep.7)
results.brief_description:
A wide ranging episode covering the expansion of commercial (over) fishing of seals, whales, cod fish as well as other issues pertaining to marine protection: oil pollution, environmental activism (Greenpeace). Other issues include: survival at sea (Dr. Bombard) and yacht racing (eric Tabarly, Chichester, A. Colas, A. Gerbaud).

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Menace Sous la Mer (Ep.6)
results.brief_description:
Historian Jean-Jacques Antier retraces the evolution of submarine engineering, from the first prototype built by David Buchnell (The Turtle) to the latest nuclear-powered models. This episode also covers France’s nuclear defense policy and its testing facility on Mururoa atoll.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Les Forteresse Flottantes (Ep.5)
results.brief_description:
This is a history of the battleship from the 19th century through the bombing of Pearl Harbour and the research into aircraft carrying ships.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Le Temps des Paquebots (Ep.4)
results.brief_description:
The period in between the world ward is the golden era of the great ocean liners and transatlantic carriers, with ships sucg as the Ile-de-France, Normandy, Queen Mary vying for the supreme honour of the blue ribbon. This episode also tells the famous tale of the sinking of the Titanic and includes a lenghthy interview with one of the survivors. Other topics include: Ellis Island and migration to the USA ; the transportation of troops across the Atlantic.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: L'aventure de la Voile (Ep.3)
results.brief_description:
In this episode we learn about the gallows that were used as war machines well into the 17th century. This episode also covers the famous battle that oppsed Sr francis Drake to the Invincible Armada of the King of Spain. This episode also announces the changes heralded by the arrival of steam engines aboard commercial ships.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: A la Decouverte du Monde (Ep.2)
results.brief_description:
This episode is dedicated to the great navigators: Colombus, Vespucci, Magellan, Jacques Cartier. It alos offers an overview of the settlement of the New World by mass migration and through the commerce of slaves. Other topics include: the exploration of the South seas by Cook, Bouguainville and Bligh ; the transfer of gold from the Americas to Spain on Galleons ; pirates.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: A la Decouverte de la Mer (Ep. 1)
results.brief_description:
This first episode focuses on the passionate relationship between man and the ocean. The sea was first of all an endless source of food for the coastal population. The series than moves on to profile the first bold sea voyagers: polynesian canoes, pharaonic pout sailing up and down the Nile as well as the Greek and roman sailors. Other topics include: Viking ship, the settlement of Greenland, the adoption of the latin (square) sail as well as the invention of the compass.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.
Cast: Interviews with Dr. Alain Bombard, Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jean Campistron.
